text: Highly localized signature of positive selection in PARP4 PARP4 , also known as vPARP ( vault PARP ) is a catalytically active poly - ADP - ribosyltransferase that is a component of widely conserved , large cytoplasmic ribonucleoprotein structures known as ' ' vaults ' ' . Vaults are barrel - shaped particles composed of three proteins , MVP ( major vault protein ) , PARP4 , and TEP1 ( telomerase associated protein ) , as well as vRNA ( vault RNA ) [ 44 ] . The function of vaults is unknown , but they have been implicated in drug resistance , cancer and immunity . In support of a role in immunity , MVP , the core structural component of the . 10 mDa mass of vaults , is upregulated by IFN , and vaults are most highly expressed in immune cell types such as dendritic cells and macrophages [ 45 ] .
